name: Aquatic Ecosystem Restoration Program
objective: The objective of the Aquatic Ecosystem Restoration Program is to work cooperatively with states, Tribes, and other entities as they study, design and construct aquatic ecosystem restoration projects that are collaboratively developed, have widespread regional benefits, and result in the improvement of the health of fisheries, wildlife, and aquatic habitat through restoration and improved fish passage. As used here, “aquatic ecosystem” refers to freshwater and brackish water habitats such as lakes, ponds, rivers, streams, wetlands, swamps, and estuaries and the adjacent floodplains, riparian corridors, deltas, and shallow aquifers that interact with surface water.
applicant_types: Indian/Native American Tribal Government (Other than Federally Recognized)

results.description: Reclamation selected 20 projects to receive $61.4 million in BIL funding.
In September 2024, Reclamation anticipates selecting 12 – 20 projects to be funded with BIL funds and appropriations.
